meanings.definition: A two-masted sailing vessel with square-rigged sails on the foremast and fore-and-aft sails on the mainmast.
meanings.sent1: The brigantines sailed gracefully across the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The sailors hoisted the brigantines' sails to catch the wind.
meanings.sent3: The pirates decided to have a race using brigantines for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were brigantines, carrying her to distant lands.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the brigantines on the horizon filled him with wanderlust.

meanings.definition: A type of armor consisting of small metal plates sewn or laced together.
meanings.sent1: The knight wore brigantines to protect himself in battle.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed ancient brigantines used by warriors long ago.
meanings.sent3: The brigantines clanked loudly as the knight tried to sneak around.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was her brigantines, shielding her from doubt.
meanings.sent5: The brigantines gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of strength and resilience.
